arm_group.description: adult liver transplantation recipients (>=20 years at the date of surgery)

biospec_descr.textblock: no biospecimens are to be retained

brief_summary.textblock:
Conventionally, the outcome of liver transplantation is usually reported in terms of graft
      and patient survival, medical and surgical complications, but lack of health-related quality
      of life (HRQOL) that might be associated with immunosuppression complications (e.g.,
      diabetes, hypertension, dyslipidemia, obesity, metabolic syndrome, cardiovascular disease,
      renal dysfunction, osteoporosis, and de novo malignancy), disease recurrence, and rejections
      after transplantation.

clinical_study.brief_title: Uses of Immunosuppression Therapy in Patients With Liver Transplantation

detailed_description.textblock:
Specific aims are proposed to achieve in this study:

        1. To compare graft and patient survival rate, incidence of treatment-related adverse
           effects between different patterns of immunosuppression combination among patients
           received post-liver transplant care in Kaohsiung Chang Gung Memorial Hospital (KCGMH),
           Taiwan.

        2. To quantify the long-term health impacts of immunosuppressive regimens on
           quality-adjusted life expectancy (QALE), the loss-of-QALE relating to immunosuppression
           therapy, and types of transplantation.

criteria.textblock:
Aim 1:

        Inclusion Criteria:

          -  age at liver transplantation is at least 20 years

        Aim 2:

        Inclusion Criteria:

          -  age at liver transplantation is at least 20 years

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  deceased patient

          -  cannot obtain inform consent

          -  age <20 years

study_pop.textblock:
Study subjects: Patients who had liver transplantation in Kaohsiung Chang Gung Memorial
        Hospital

clinical_study.official_title: Trends of Immunosuppression Therapy and Their Effectiveness in Patients With Liver Transplantation

other_outcome.description:
QALE:quality-adjusted weight for each health status (measured by EQ-5D)will be multiplied by the survival time and then summed to calculate the number of QALE.
Loss-of QALE: the life time expectancy (survival function) for thes study cohort will be compared with Taiwan general population of subjects who are age- and gender-matched with study subjects.

primary_outcome.description: Patient will be followed from the date of liver transplantation to the occurence of outcome event for 5 years
primary_outcome.measure: incidence of graft and patient mortality, treatment-related complications

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: health-related quality of life will be measured by EQ-5D-5L and 15D
